intro: Dichaea cachacoensis, commonly known as the Cachacoensis Moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is native to the humid tropical regions of South America, particularly in Brazil. This plant is characterized by its delicate, leafy structure and its ability to thrive in shaded, moist environments. Dichaea cachacoensis typically grows on the forest floor or on rocks, forming dense, low-growing mats. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in tropical rainforests.
